text: Sarandi Sobral is a Uruguayan beach soccer player. He also practices futsal and footvolley, two disciplines where he was also called as a team of Uruguay. ==Career== Sarandi Sobral decides is nicknamed Pampero in homage to his father who was like the horse Paturuzú. On March 26, 2011, Pampero and Vasco da Gama entered the history of beach soccer by defeating Sporting Portugal (4-2) in the final of the first club world cup. The Uruguayan was the best player in the competition. In March 2012, for the Brazilian Cup, Pampero joined Botafogo. ==External links== * Profile at Ogol Category:Sportspeople from Montevideo Category:1978 births Category:Living people Category:Beach soccer players Category:Uruguayan men's futsal players Category:Uruguayan beach soccer players
title: Sarandi Sobral
